p: The toxicity activity of the acylated uridine derivatives 4– 15 in the brine shrimp lethality bioassay method (McLaughlin, 1991) is presented in Figure 9, which showed the percentage of mortality of shrimps at 24 h and 48 h. From the data, it was evident that the test chemicals 5′˗ O˗(4˗ t˗butylbenzoyl)˗2′,3′˗di˗ O˗pentanoyl-uridine ( 7) and 5′- O-(4- t-butylbenzoyl)-2′,3′-di- O-lauroyluridine ( 10) showed highest levels of toxicity (i.e. ∼57% death) indicating its higher mortality. The rest of the compounds were found less toxic for brine shrimp ( Figure 9).
